ticket.title: activesupport 3.0.6 gem: require 'active_support/core_ext' generates "circular require" warning
ticket.original-body:
I am getting in activesupport 3.0.6 a "circular require" warning when running ruby or irb with -w option. There were no such warning in 3.0.5.
If I do @@@ $ irb -w > require 'active_support/core_ext' @@@ I get "warning: loading in progress, circular require considered harmful...".
If I do @@@ $ irb -w > gem 'activesupport', '=3.0.5' > require 'active_support/core_ext' @@@ it works quietly.
It this a bug in activesupport 3.0.6 gem?
ticket.latest-body:
I am getting in activesupport 3.0.6 a "circular require" warning when running ruby or irb with -w option. There were no such warning in 3.0.5.

If I do @@@ $ irb -w > gem 'activesupport', '=3.0.5' > require 'active_support/core_ext' @@@ it works quietly.
It this a bug in activesupport 3.0.6 gem?
ticket.original-body-html:
I am getting in activesupport 3.0.6 a "circular require" warning when running ruby or irb with -w option.
There were no such warning in 3.0.5.

If I do

$ irb -w
> require 'active_support/core_ext'

I get
"warning: loading in progress, circular require considered harmful...".

If I do

$ irb -w
> gem 'activesupport', '=3.0.5'
> require 'active_support/core_ext'

it works quietly.

It this a bug in activesupport 3.0.6 gem?

version.title: activesupport 3.0.6 gem: require 'active_support/core_ext' generates "circular require" warning

version.body: This warning is still present in `activesupport 3.0.7`.
version.title: activesupport 3.0.6 gem: require 'active_support/core_ext' generates "circular require" warning

version.body: Hi Alexey, could you please provide a patch?
version.body-html: Hi Alexey, could you please provide a patch?
version.title: activesupport 3.0.6 gem: require 'active_support/core_ext' generates "circular require" warning

version.body: Sorry Xavier, I am new to Rails, i have never patched anything before, and i do not know where this bug originates from.
version.body-html: Sorry Xavier, I am new to Rails, i have never patched anything before, and i do not know where this bug originates from.
version.title: activesupport 3.0.6 gem: require 'active_support/core_ext' generates "circular require" warning

version.body:
Cool. I emailed some starting material via the mailing list in case you'd like to try. It's a good exercise, and since this is a circular require it does not require knowledge of Rails internals. I encourage you to try it if you feel like it :).
Otherwise, no worries Alexey, perhaps someone may provide a patch.
version.body-html:
Cool. I emailed some starting material via the mailing list in case you'd like to try. It's a good exercise, and since this is a circular require it does not require knowledge of Rails internals. I encourage you to try it if you feel like it :).

Otherwise, no worries Alexey, perhaps someone may provide a patch.
version.title: activesupport 3.0.6 gem: require 'active_support/core_ext' generates "circular require" warning

version.body: Thanks Xavier, i'll think about it. Was i supposed to receive your message through the mailing list? I wasn't receiving any messages, so i just activated "Ruby on Rails" in my subscriptions, it was off. Can you send it to me directly at muranov@math.univ-toulouse.fr please?
version.body-html:
Thanks Xavier, i'll think about it.
Was i supposed to receive your message through the mailing list?
I wasn't receiving any messages, so i just activated "Ruby on Rails" in my subscriptions, it was off.
Can you send it to me directly at muranov@math.univ-toulouse.fr please?
